snippet: Longtime residents complain of crowded homes, driveways and schools as a steady stream of mostly Hispanic workers has moved in, drawn by a service economy.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column; steady stream of mostly Hispanic workers has been flowing to East Hampton, LI, for years, drawn by a service economy that demands that hedges be trimmed and houses cleaned; rising immigrant population, however, has led to tensions in some communities as longtime residents complain of crowded homes, driveways and schools.
lead_paragraph: Longtime residents complain of crowded homes, driveways and schools as a steady stream of mostly Hispanic workers has moved in, drawn by a service economy.

headline.seo: East Hampton Chafes Under Influx of Immigrants
headline.main: Tension for East Hampton as Immigrants Stream In
headline.print_headline: Tension for East Hampton As Immigrants Stream In
